name: Session Output Management System
description: Implement a local output folder system for storing session-based context, memory, and documentation that is gitignored and organized by date and topic.
business_value: Provides AI agents and developers with a structured, local workspace for session outputs without polluting the git repository or documentation system.
goals: Create standardized folder structure at project root
Enable session-based organization of context and outputs
Maintain git repository cleanliness through proper ignore rules
Provide clear documentation and templates for consistent usage
Integrate guidance into existing AI agent documentation (CLAUDE.md)

personas.name: developer
personas.description: Human developer using Claude Code to work on the codebase
needs: Understand when and how to use the output folder
Keep session data local and not tracked in git

personas.name: ai_agent
personas.description: Claude or other AI agents working on the codebase through Claude Code
needs: Structured location for session context and memory
Consistent metadata format for session documentation
Clear guidance on session management workflow

out_of_scope: AI agent memory persistence between sessions

technical_requirements.details: Local .gitignore in /output/ ignoring all except README.md and .gitignore itself
YAML format with fields: session_id, date, topic, description, agent, goals, outcomes, files_modified, tags
.current-session file containing active session folder name

success_metrics.target: 100% - all directories and placeholder files exist
0 session files tracked in git (except README.md)
README covers all aspects: purpose, structure, conventions, workflow, examples
New section added with clear guidance and link to full docs
Session metadata template is valid YAML with clear field descriptions

assumptions: Single developer/user environment (no collaboration on session data)
Session data is ephemeral and can be archived or deleted
Output folder is for local use only (not deployed)
Developers/agents will manually manage session lifecycle
No existing output folder system to migrate from

risks.mitigation: Clear documentation stating output/ is for local session data only
Clear examples and template in documentation
Archive/ folder and archiving guidelines in README

dependencies.description: Must be implemented at project root, requires git repository
Must integrate with existing CLAUDE.md structure and conventions
